parameter.name: basePath
parameter.description: Base path to use for all requests that reference this config.

parameter.name: listenerInterceptors
parameter.description: Listener interceptors that will apply on request and on response events.

config.name: requestConfig
config.description: Configuration element for a HTTP requests.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: basePath
parameter.description: Base path to use for all requests that reference this config.

parameter.name: followRedirects
parameter.description: Specifies whether to follow redirects or not. Default value is true.

parameter.name: sendBodyMode
parameter.description: Defines if the request should contain a body or not. If AUTO, it will depend on the method (GET, HEAD and OPTIONS will not send a body).

parameter.name: requestStreamingMode
parameter.description: Defines if the request should be sent using streaming or not. If this attribute is not present, the behavior will depend on the type of the payload (it will stream only for InputStream). If set to true, it will always stream. If set to false, it will never stream. As streaming is done the request will be sent user Transfer-Encoding: chunked.

parameter.name: enableCookies
parameter.description: If true, cookies received in HTTP responses will be stored, and sent in subsequent HTTP requests.

parameter.name: defaultHeaders
parameter.description: Default HTTP headers the message should include.

parameter.name: defaultQueryParams
parameter.description: Default Query parameters the request should include.

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: Whether to specify a correlationId when publishing messages. This applies both for custom correlation ids specifies at the operation level and for default correlation Ids taken from the current event

parameter.name: preserveHeadersCase
parameter.description:
By default, header keys are stored internally in lower-case. This is to improve performance of headers handling and is functionally correct as specified in the RFC.

In the case a server expects headers in a specific case, this flag may be set to true so the case of the header keys are preserved.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Maximum time that the request element will block the execution of the flow waiting for the HTTP response. If this value is not present, the default response timeout from the Mule configuration will be used.

parameter.name: responseValidator
parameter.description: Configures a default error handling of the response.

connection.name: listener
connection.description: Connection provider for a HttpListener, handles the creation of HttpServer instances.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Reference to a TLS config element. This will enable HTTPS for this config.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host where the requests will be sent.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port where the requests will be received.

parameter.name: usePersistentConnections
parameter.description: If false, each connection will be closed after the first request is completed.

parameter.name: connectionIdleTimeout
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds that a connection can remain idle before it is closed. The value of this attribute is only used when persistent connections are enabled.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: request
connection.description: Connection provider for a HTTP request, handles the creation of HttpExtensionClient instances.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Reference to a TLS config element. This will enable HTTPS for this config.

parameter.name: proxyConfig
parameter.description: Reusable configuration element for outbound connections through a proxy. A proxy element must define a host name and a port attributes, and optionally can define a username and a password.

parameter.name: authentication
parameter.description: Authentication method to use for the HTTP request.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user can customize the tls/ssl configuration by defining the tls:context child element of this listener-config. If not tls:context is defined then the default JVM certificates are going to be used to establish communication.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host where the requests will be sent.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port where the requests will be sent. If the protocol attribute is HTTP (default) then the default value is 80, if the protocol attribute is HTTPS then the default value is 443.

parameter.name: usePersistentConnections
parameter.description: If false, each connection will be closed after the first request is completed.

parameter.name: maxConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of outbound connections that will be kept open at the same time. By default the number of connections is unlimited.

parameter.name: connectionIdleTimeout
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds that a connection can remain idle before it is closed. The value of this attribute is only used when persistent connections are enabled.

parameter.name: streamResponse
parameter.description: Whether or not received responses should be streamed, meaning processing will continue as soon as all headers are parsed and the body streamed as it arrives. When enabled, the response MUST be eventually read since depending on the configured buffer size it may not fit into memory and processing will stop until space is available.

parameter.name: responseBufferSize
parameter.description: The space in bytes for the buffer where the HTTP response will be stored.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

extension.name: HTTP
extension.description:
HTTP connector used to handle and perform HTTP requests.

This class only serves as an extension definition. It's configurations are divided on server () and client () capabilities.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: The HTTP method for the request.

parameter.name: outputMimeType
parameter.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: outputEncoding
parameter.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Path where the request will be sent.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: URL where to send the request.

parameter.name: followRedirects
parameter.description: Specifies whether to follow redirects or not.

parameter.name: sendBodyMode
parameter.description: Defines if the request should contain a body or not.

parameter.name: requestStreamingMode
parameter.description: Defines if the request should be sent using streaming or not.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Maximum time that the request element will block the execution of the flow waiting for the HTTP response.

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The body of the response message

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: HTTP headers the message should include.

parameter.name: uriParams
parameter.description: URI parameters that should be used to create the request.

parameter.name: queryParams
parameter.description: Query parameters the request should include.

parameter.name: sendCorrelationId
parameter.description: Options on whether to include an outbound correlation id or not

parameter.name: correlationId
parameter.description: Allows to set a custom correlation id

parameter.name: responseValidator
parameter.description: Configures error handling of the response.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: basicSecurityFilter
operation.description: Authenticates received HTTP requests. Must be used after a listener component.

parameter.name: realm
parameter.description: Authentication realm.

parameter.name: securityProviders
parameter.description: The delegate-security-provider to use for authenticating. Use this in case you have multiple security managers defined in your configuration.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The HttpRequestAttributes coming from an HTTP listener source to check the 'Authorization' header.

operation.name: loadStaticResource
operation.description: Serves up static content for use with HTTP, using the request path to lookup the resource.

parameter.name: resourceBasePath
parameter.description: The resource base from where documents are served up. For example: /Users/maxthemule/resources

parameter.name: defaultFile
parameter.description: The default file to serve when a directory is specified. The default value is 'index.html'.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The HttpRequestAttributes coming from an HTTP listener source to check the required resources.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

source.name: listener
source.description: Represents a listener for HTTP requests.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Relative path from the path set in the HTTP Listener configuration

parameter.name: allowedMethods
parameter.description: Comma separated list of allowed HTTP methods by this listener. To allow all methods do not defined the attribute.

parameter.name: responseStreamingMode
parameter.description: Defines if the response should be sent using streaming or not. If this attribute is not present, the behavior will depend on the type of the payload (it will stream only for InputStream). If set to true, it will always stream. If set to false, it will never stream. As streaming is done the response will be sent user Transfer-Encoding: chunked.

parameter.name: outputMimeType
parameter.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: outputEncoding
parameter.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The body of the response message.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: HTTP headers the message should include.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: HTTP status code the response should have.

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: HTTP reason phrase the response should have.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.HttpRequestAttributes
type.description:
Representation of an HTTP request message attributes.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: Map of HTTP headers in the message. Former properties.

parameter.name: queryParams
parameter.description: Query parameters map built from the parsed string. Former 'http.query.params'.

parameter.name: uriParams
parameter.description: URI parameters extracted from the request path. Former 'http.uri.params'.

parameter.name: requestPath
parameter.description: Full path requested. Former 'http.request.path'.

parameter.name: listenerPath
parameter.description: Full path where the request was received. Former 'http.listener.path'.

parameter.name: rawRequestPath
parameter.description:
Full path requested, encoded as received.
@since 1.5.0

parameter.name: relativePath
parameter.description: Path where the request was received, without considering the base path. Former 'http.relative.path'.

parameter.name: maskedRequestPath
version
parameter.description: HTTP version of the request. Former 'http.version'.

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.description: HTTP scheme of the request. Former 'http.scheme'.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: HTTP method of the request. Former 'http.method'.

parameter.name: requestUri
parameter.description: Full URI of the request. Former 'http.request.uri'.

parameter.name: rawRequestUri
parameter.description:
Full URI of the request, encoded as received.
@since 1.5.0

parameter.name: queryString
parameter.description: Query string of the request. Former 'http.query.string'.

parameter.name: localAddress
parameter.description: Local host address from the server.

parameter.name: remoteAddress
parameter.description: Remote host address from the sender. Former 'http.remote.address'.

parameter.name: clientCertificate
parameter.description: Client certificate (if 2 way TLS is enabled). Former 'http.client.cert'.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.HttpResponseAttributes
type.description:
Representation of an HTTP response message attributes.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: Map of HTTP headers in the message. Former properties.

parameter.name: statusCode
parameter.description: HTTP status code of the response. Former 'http.status'.

parameter.name: reasonPhrase
parameter.description: HTTP reason phrase of the response. Former 'http.reason'.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.listener.intercepting.cors.CorsInterceptorWrapper
type.description:
The HTTP Connector MAY allow (in the future) a collection of interceptors in the listener. If this is implemented, we would like to have the XML config structure backward compatible.

CorsInterceptorWrapper emulates the XML structure within the listener config for handling multiple interceptors but restricted only to CORS.

parameter.name: corsInterceptor
parameter.description: Interceptor which validates that requests match CORS specification and acts on responses accordingly.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.notification.HttpNotificationData
type.description:
Base class for HTTP notification related data.
@since 1.1

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.policy.HttpPolicyRequestAttributes

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: Map of HTTP headers in the message. Former properties.

parameter.name: queryParams
parameter.description: Query parameters map built from the parsed string. Former 'http.query.params'.

parameter.name: uriParams
parameter.description: URI parameters extracted from the request path. Former 'http.uri.params'.

parameter.name: requestPath
parameter.description: Full path requested. Former 'http.request.path'.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.authentication.BasicAuthentication
type.description:
Configures basic authentication for the requests.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate.

parameter.name: preemptive
parameter.description: Configures if authentication should be preemptive or not. Preemptive authentication will send the authentication header in the first request, instead of waiting for a 401 response code to send it.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.authentication.DigestAuthentication
type.description:
Configures digest authentication for the requests.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate.

parameter.name: preemptive
parameter.description: Configures if authentication should be preemptive or not. Preemptive authentication will send the authentication header in the first request, instead of waiting for a 401 response code to send it.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.authentication.HttpRequestAuthentication
type.description:
An object that authenticates an HTTP request.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.authentication.NtlmAuthentication
type.description:
Configures NTLM authentication for the requests.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate.

parameter.name: preemptive
parameter.description: Configures if authentication should be preemptive or not. Preemptive authentication will send the authentication header in the first request, instead of waiting for a 401 response code to send it.

parameter.name: domain
parameter.description: The domain to authenticate.

parameter.name: workstation
parameter.description: The workstation to authenticate.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.proxy.DefaultNtlmProxyConfig
type.description:
A Proxy configuration for NTLM authentication proxies.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: nonProxyHosts
parameter.description: A list of comma separated hosts against which the proxy should not be used

parameter.name: ntlmDomain
parameter.description: The domain to authenticate against the proxy.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.proxy.DefaultProxyConfig
type.description:
Basic HTTP Proxy configuration based on host and port, and optionally a username and password for proxy authentication.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: nonProxyHosts
parameter.description: A list of comma separated hosts against which the proxy should not be used

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.proxy.HttpProxyConfig
type.description: Marker interface for exposing the proxy configuration as an imported type.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.validator.FailureStatusCodeValidator

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: Status codes that will be considered.

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.validator.ResponseValidator
type.description:
Configures error handling of the response.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.http.api.request.validator.SuccessStatusCodeValidator

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: Status codes that will be considered.
